title: Roman Abramovich to block sale of Eden Hazard? Transfer news and gossip from Friday's papers
text:
Sport Roman Abramovich to block sale of Eden Hazard? Transfer news and gossip from Friday's papers PLUS: West Brom manager Tony Pulis will fly out to China in May to hold talks with the club's owners over the summer transfer budget Share Get Chelsea   
Eden Hazard will not be leaving Chelsea this summer, according to the Daily Express. 
Real Madrid are rumoured to be interested in the Belgian and Antonio Conte might be willing to entertain an offer for his talisman. 
Chelsea's owner, however, is determined to keep hold of the former Lille man. 
The Express say Roman Abramovich will block any attempt by Real Madrid to sign him, even if Conte is willing to sell. Top stories from Friday's Mirror 
Chelsea believe they have beaten Manchester City in the £50million race to sign Virgil van Dijk. Antonio Conte's Premier League leaders have made the Southampton and Holland defender their No1 priority this summer and are ready to break the bank to get him. The West London Blues are supremely confident they will get him ahead of City, Everton and Liverpool, who have all been in for the former Celtic centre-half. Where will Van Dijk end up? (Photo: PA) 
Crystal Palace's Yohan Cabaye is set to find himself the target of a fresh move from Marseille this summer. The Eagles asked £16million for the France international midfielder after an enquiry from the French club in January. Marseille chose to wait until the summer, when the 31-year-old will have just a year left on his contract. 
Four Premier League clubs are in the hunt for Dynamo Kiev defender Domagoj Vida. West Ham, Stoke and Everton are battling Sunderland for the 27-year-old Croatia international, who will have a year left on his contract in the summer. 
Romelu Lukaku risks being left a big-club bench-warmer again, like he was at Chelsea, if he leaves Everton in search of Champions League football, warns Paul Ince. Other news Paul Pogba has been told to concentrate on his football (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
Jose Mourinho has told Paul Pogba - who became the world's most expensive player when he rejoined United last sumer after four years in Italy with Juventus - to reduce his extensive off-field commercial activities and concentrate on his Manchester United career. It's understood Reds boss Mourinho was unhappy with midfielder Pogba’s recent Twitter emoji stunt, and does not want his off-the-field activities to become a distraction. Transfer news from other newspapers and websites 
West Brom manager Tony Pulis will fly out to China in May to hold talks with the club's owners over the summer transfer budget. (Telegraph) 
Rangers' search for a new assistant manager will be concluded this week. (Daily Record) Like us on Facebook
